content:
Yes, there have been several recent developments on Senegal's involvement in peacekeeping efforts in the region. Here are a few examples:

1. As of 2021, Senegal has been contributing troops to the United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) since 2013, as part of its efforts to support peace and stability in Mali.

2. In 2020, Senegal was one of the first countries to contribute troops to the ECOWAS Military Intervention in The Gambia (ECOMIG), which helped to prevent a political crisis in The Gambia.

3. In September 2021, Senegal hosted the 4th edition of the Dakar International Forum on Peace and Security in Africa. The theme of the forum was "Current Security Challenges in Africa: Towards a New Governance Architecture," and it aimed to promote discussion and generate new ideas for addressing security challenges on the continent.

4. In November 2021, Senegal participated in the joint military exercise "Flintlock 2021," which brought together over 2,000 soldiers from 27 countries to improve their ability to respond to regional security threats.

Overall, Senegal's commitment to promoting peace and stability in the region remains strong, and the country continues to be an active participant in regional peacekeeping efforts.
